channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- Support Board
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- Support Board

item.title: CVE-2021-24823|2024-08-03T19:42:17.351Z -- unknown -- support%20board
item.description: The Support Board WordPress plugin before 3.3.6 does not have any CSRF checks in actions handled by the include/ajax.php file, which could allow attackers to make logged in users do unwanted actions. For example, make an admin delete arbitrary files

item.title: CVE-2021-24741|2024-08-03T19:42:16.654Z -- unknown -- support%20board
item.description: The Support Board WordPress plugin before 3.3.4 does not escape multiple POST parameters (such as status_code, department, user_id, conversation_id, conversation_status_code, and recipient_id) before using them in SQL statements, leading to SQL injections which are exploitable by unauthenticated users.

item.title: CVE-2021-24807|2024-08-03T19:42:17.186Z -- unknown -- support%20board
item.description: The Support Board WordPress plugin before 3.3.5 allows Authenticated (Agent+) users to perform Cross-Site Scripting attacks by placing a payload in the notes field, when an administrator or any authenticated user go to the chat the XSS will be automatically executed.
